title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 28.3 - Books and records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 28.3 - Books and records

State Regulations

Each holder of a distributor's alcohol permit shall keep
and maintain upon the premises designated in said permit adequate books and
records of all transactions involving the purchase and sale of said alcohol, which shall show the amount of alcohol, in gallons, purchased by such
distributor together with the names, permit numbers, and places of business of
the persons from whom the same was purchased, and the amount involved in such
purchase, as well as the amount of alcohol sold by such distributor together
with the names, addresses and permit numbers of such purchasers and the size of
the containers in which the same was sold to such purchasers, whether the same
shall be purchased or sold within or without the state. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
28.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
